videos.title: The Alphabet Song | Kids Songs | Super Simple Songs
videos.description:
Get the Super Simple App! ► http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp 
Learn the ABCs with this remake of our classic video for an all-time favorite children's song, The Alphabet Song. Sing along as the magical magnetic letters arrange themselves on the classroom whiteboard. 

This version of the ABC song first introduces all of the letters of the alphabet slowly and clearly in the first verse. In the second verse, sing along at super simple pace. Finally, in the third verse, see if you can sing the abcs on your own!

A turtle!

To see what she could see see see
But all that she could see see see

A blue whale!
A sailor went to sea sea sea
To see what she could see see see
But all that she could see see see

Need a pick-me-up? We've got just the song for you! My Happy Song is a super fun and super silly call-and-repeat style song that encourages young ones to sing along in a low voice, a high voice, an underwater voice, and super fast! To expand on the song, encourage young ones to sing along in different styles of voices, like a robot voice, a monster voice, opera style, like a chicken, etc. Have fun! 🎶 This is my happy song. And the green grass grew all around.

And in this nest.

That you ever did see. 

Well, the egg was in the nest,
and the nest was on the branch, 
and the branch was on the tree, 
and the tree was in the hole,
and the hole was in the ground.
And the green grass grew all around, all around.
And the green grass grew all around.

And in this egg.
There was a bird.

That you ever did see.

Well, the bird was in the egg, 
and the egg was in the nest,
and the nest was on the branch, 
and the branch was on the tree, 
and the tree was in the hole,
and the hole was in the ground.
And the green grass grew all around, all around.
And the green grass grew all around.

And the green grass grew all around, all around.
And the green grass grew all around.

Get the Super Simple App! ► http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp 
It's "The Ice Cream Song" from Super Simple Songs! Many people have asked us for an ice cream song for kids over the years and here it is! In our ice cream song, kids also get to practice counting by counting the number of scoops on the ice cream cone. This collection of kids songs also includes "Do You Like Broccoli Ice Cream?", "Who Took The Cookie?", "Do You Like Lasagna Milkshakes?", and many more of our best children's songs and nursery rhymes. How many scoops of ice cream would you like?

videos.title: Pink Purple Orange Brown 🩷💜🧡🤎 | Kids Colors Song | featuring The Bumble Nums | Super Simple Songs
videos.description:
Get the Super Simple App! ► http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp 
Sing along with The Bumble Nums in this fun follow up to the colors song, Red Yellow Green Blue! This time, learn about the colors pink, purple, orange, and brown with Stumble, Grumble, and Humble. After singing the song, go on a color hunt and see what kind of pink, purple, orange, and brown things you can find around you. 🎶 Pink is the color of cotton candy. Purple is the color of a grape. Orange is the color of great big pumpkin. And brown is the color of a chocolate cake. 🎶

videos.title: Everything Is Going To Be Alright | Super Simple Songs
videos.description:
Get the Super Simple App! ► http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp 
Stop, close your eyes and take a deep breath because everything is going to be alright with this sweet and original kids song from Super Simple Songs, "Everything Is Going To Be Alright"! 🎶 Sometimes I get a little angry. When I can’t find my favorite toy.  Sometimes I get a little angry. When I can’t find my favorite toy. Then I stop. I close my eyes and take a deep breath. 'Cause everything is going to be alright. 🎶

The engine on the bus goes, “Vroom vroom vroom. Vroom vroom vroom. Vroom vroom vroom.”
The engine on the bus goes, “Vroom vroom vroom. Vroom vroom vroom.”
The bell on the bus goes, "Ding ding ding. Ding ding ding. Ding ding ding."
The bell on the bus goes, "Ding ding ding. Ding ding ding.”

Lyrics:
Three little kittens, they lost their mittens, 
And they began to cry,
“Oh, mother dear, we sadly fear, 
That we have lost our mittens.”
“Lost your mittens, you naughty kittens! 
Then you shall have no pie.
Meow, meow, meow, meow.
Then you shall have no pie.”

Three little kittens, they found their mittens, 
And they began to cry, 
“Oh, mother dear, see here, see here, 
For we have found our mittens.”
“Put on your mittens, you silly kittens, 
And you shall have some pie.”
“Meow, meow, meow, meow
Oh, let us have some pie.”

Three little kittens put on their mittens, 
And soon ate up the pie, 
“Oh, mother dear, we greatly fear, 
That we have soiled our mittens.”
“Soiled your mittens, you naughty kittens." 
Then they began to sigh, 
"Meow, meow, meow, meow.”
Then they began to sigh.

Three little kittens, they washed their mittens, 
And hung them out to dry, 
“Oh, mother dear, do you not hear, 
That we have washed our mittens?”
“Washed your mittens, then you're good kittens, 
And you shall have some pie.
Meow, meow meow, meow.
And you shall have some pie”

Let’s see your happy face! How about a sleepy face? Can you make an excited face? Let’s see a silly face! This song is great for teaching emotions. Mama's gonna buy you a looking glass.

Mama's gonna buy you a billy goat. 

And if that billy goat gets cross, 
Mama's gonna buy you a rocking horse. 

And if that rocking horse turns over, 
Mama's gonna buy you a dog named Rover. 

And if that dog named Rover won't bark, 
Mama's gonna buy you a horse and cart. 

And if that horse and cart fall down,

Let’s decorate the house for Halloween,
spookier than you’ve ever seen.
We’ll make our house a spooky sight,
before we trick or treat on Halloween night.

Let’s drape a big white sheet up over there,
to look like a ghost flying through the air.
And set a pointy hat next to a broom,
to look like a witch lives in this room.

Let’s carve a silly face into a pumpkin,
triangle eyes and a toothy grin.
And when the carving’s done where should they go?
Out on the porch where they can glow.

Let’s decorate the house for Halloween,
spookier than you’ve ever seen.
We’ll make our house a spooky sight,
before we trick or treat on Halloween night.

Let’s tie some strands of yarn in knots and braids,
to look like a web that a spider made.
And cut some paper out to look like bats.
What could be spookier than that?

Then, finally we’ll fill a bowl with sweets,
for everyone who comes to trick or treat.
Trick or treat, trick or treat,
we’ll give them something good to eat!

Let’s decorate the house for Halloween,
spookier than you’ve ever seen.

Lyrics:
Let’s decorate our Christmas tree.
As pretty as a tree can be.
We’ll decorate and we won’t stop.
Until we put the star on top.

First come the lights all in a line.
Soon they’ll make the whole tree shine.
Round and round the tree they go.
From way up high to way down low.

Let’s decorate our Christmas tree.
As pretty as a tree can be.
We’ll decorate and we won’t stop.
Until we put the star on top.

Next are the ornaments big and small.
Let’s find some spots to hang them all.
So many places they can go.
From way up high to way down low.

Let’s decorate our Christmas tree.
As pretty as a tree can be.
We’ll decorate and we won’t stop.
Until we put the star on top.

Next we’ll hang some tinsel here and there,
to make it sparkle everywhere.
All around the tree it goes.
From way up high to way down low.

Let’s decorate our Christmas tree.
As pretty as a tree can be.
We’ll decorate and we won’t stop.
Until we put the star on top.

Last comes the star so big and bright.
To share with us its Christmas light.
There’s only one place it should be.
At the very top of our Christmas tree.

Let’s decorate our Christmas tree.
As pretty as a tree can be.
We’ll decorate and we won’t stop.
Until we put the star on top.

videos.title: Beddy-Bye Butterfly 🦋 | Lullaby for Bedtime | Super Simple Songs
videos.description:
Get the Super Simple App!  ► http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp
It's bedtime in the forest. Sing a soothing lullaby with Lulu the Owl and Juno the Star.  🎶 Beddy-bye, butterfly, tuck into your flower. Dream butterfly dreams 'till the morning hour. 🎶 🦋

PARENTS AND TEACHERS: Thank you so much for watching Super Simple Songs with your families and/or students. Here are some other places to find great Super Simple content:

Instagram: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleInsta
Twitter: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleTwitter
Pinterest: http://bit.ly/SuperSimplePinterest

Lyrics: 
High above the forest
in the night sky.
The stars are shining brightly,
time for Beddy-Bye.
Star flew down to owl,
who hooted and said,
“let’s say good night to all our friends
and put them all to bed.”

Beddy-bye, butterfly
tuck into your flower.
Dream butterfly dreams
‘till the morning hour.

Beddy-bye, baby bear
lay down in your den,
until the sun rises
and it’s morning again.

Beddy-bye, bunny rabbit
close your eyes and dream
of all the games tomorrow
we will play by the stream.

Beddy-bye, little squirrel
curl up in your nest.
You gathered acorns all day long
and now it’s time to rest.

Beddy-bye, slith’ry snake
curl up nice and tight.
We’ll meet again tomorrow
in the early morning light.

Beddy-bye, tiny turtle
rest inside your shell.
Slowly you will fall asleep.
We hope that you sleep well.

Beddy-bye, friendly frog.
Let’s not make a sound.
In the morning you will ribbit
and hop all around.

Beddy-bye, little bird.
Though the night seems long,
soon it will be morning
and we’ll wake to your song.

Now we’ve said goodnight.
to our friends near and far.
Beddy-bye to you, Owl.
Beddy-bye to you, Star.
*********

Yikes, it’s getting a little harder...and spookier! Here we go again!

Q, [Boo], S,
[Boo], U, V,
[Booooo], X,
[Boo], and Z.

Oh wow! So many ghosts! Do you want to try again?!

A, [Boo], C, [Boo], E, F, [Boo],
H, I, J, [Boo], L, [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo],
Q, R, [Boo],
T, U, V,
[Booooo], [Boo],
Y, and Z.

Great job everyone! What? You want to try one more time? Okay. Here we go!

A, [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo],
[Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo], [Boo],
[Boo], [Boo], [Boo],
[Boo], [Boo], [Boo],
W, [Boo],
[Boo], and [Boo].

Lyrics: 
Snow is falling down.
Let’s make a snowman.
Snow is falling all around.
Let’s make a snowman.

First we need to roll some snow
into some great big balls.
And when that’s done we’ll stack them up
to make our snowman tall!

A pair of sticks to make two arms
and gloves to make two hands.
We’ll make our snowman wave hello,
just like a person can.

Snow is falling down.
Let’s make a snowman.
Snow is falling all around.
Let’s make a snowman.

Snow is falling down.
Let’s make a snowman.
Snow is falling all around.
Let’s make a snowman.

What can we use to make a face
that stands out from the snow?
Some stones to make the eyes and mouth.
A carrot for the nose.

A hat to go on our snowman’s head
and then I think we’re done.
Step back and see our snowman smile
and wave to everyone.

Snow is falling down.
Let’s make a snowman.
Snow is falling all around.
Let’s make a snowman.
Let’s make a snowman.
Let’s make a snowman.

Scrub scrub scrub.

Now it’s time to rinse.
We’ve cleaned our fingertips.

videos.description:

PARENTS AND TEACHERS: Thank you so much for watching Super Simple Songs with your families and/or students. Here are some other places to find great Super Simple content:

Instagram: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleInsta
Twitter: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleTwitter
Pinterest: http://bit.ly/SuperSimplePinterest 
*********
Lyrics: 
Six little ducks that I once knew.
Proud ones, happy ones, silly ones, too.
But the one little duck with the feather on her back.
She led the others with a quack, quack, quack.
Quack, quack, quack. Quack, quack, quack.
She led the others with a quack, quack, quack.

Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Quack quack quack.

Down to the river they would go.
Wibble wobble. Wibble wobble. To and fro.
But the one little duck with the feather on her back.
She led the others with a quack, quack, quack.
Quack, quack, quack. Quack, quack, quack.
She led the others with a quack, quack, quack.

Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Quack quack quack.

Home from the river they would come.
Wibble wobble. Wibble wobble. Ho hum hum.
But the one little duck with the feather on her back.
She led the others with a quack, quack, quack.
Quack, quack, quack. Quack, quack, quack.
She led the others with a quack, quack, quack.

Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Quack quack quack.

Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Quack quack quack.

Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Wibble wobble wibble wobble,
Quack quack quack.
**********

videos.title: Super Simple Disco | Kids Dance Song | Super Simple Songs
videos.description:
Get the Super Simple App!  ► http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp
It's disco dance time! Learn some funky dance moves with Pancake, Quibbly, and Nelson. 🎶 Point your finger! Wheels on the bus! Move on back! 🎶

PARENTS AND TEACHERS: Thank you so much for watching Super Simple Songs with your families and/or students. Here are some other places to find great Super Simple content:

► SUPER SIMPLE APP -- http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp Be the first to watch new Super Simple videos in the Super Simple App! Ad-free and designed for young learners.
► YOUTUBE KIDS -- http://bit.ly/You-Tube-Kids Designed to make it safer and simpler for young ones to watch online video, YouTube Kids includes a suite of parental controls so you can tailor the experience to suit your family’s needs.
► AMAZON VIDEO Are you an Amazon Prime member? Watch Super Simple videos ad-free on Amazon Prime Video. Just search for “Super Simple.”

FREE SUPER SIMPLE TEACHING RESOURCES: http://bit.ly/SSFree-Resources

SOCIAL MEDIA: 
Super Simple Newsletter Sign Up: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSignUp
Facebook: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleFacebook
Instagram: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleInsta
Twitter: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleTwitter
Pinterest: http://bit.ly/SuperSimplePinterest 
*********
Lyrics: 
Hey everybody... Let’s dance!
Point your finger in the air like you are pointing at an airplane.
Now point it down at the ground like you are pointing at a bug.

Point up.
Point down.
Point up.
Point down.

Up.
Down.
Up.
Down.
Up, down, up, down.
Up, down, up, down.
Stop!

Now, let’s try another move. Roll your hands like the wheels on the bus.

Roll.
Roll.
Roll.
Roll.

Roll.
Roll.
Roll.
Roll.
Roll, roll, roll, roll.
Roll, roll, roll, roll.
Stop!

Now, point your thumbs behind you like you are saying, “Move on back.”

Point back.
Point back.
Point back.
Point back.

Point back.
Point back.
Point back.
Point back.
Back, back, back, back.
Back, back, back, back.
Stop!

Now let’s put them all together and dance!

Point your finger!
Wheels on the bus!
Move on back!
Point.
Wheels.
Move on back.
Move on back.
Point.
Wheels.
Move on back.
Move on back.
Dance!
*********

Let’s go to the beach!

There’s so much that we could do.
I want to do it all.

Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!

We’ll look for seashells,
buried in the sand.
Draw pictures with a stick,
or even just our hand.

We’ll make some footprints
as we walk along the shore.
We’ll take a break and have a snack,
and then we’ll play some more.

Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!

We’ll have so much fun.
Underneath the sun.
Lots to do and see.
Splash along with me.

Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
Let’s go to the beach!
*********

Lyrics: 
We’re going to the farm today.
It’s so much fun, we’re gonna play.
We’ll look at all the pumpkins in a row.

We’ll pick one that’s nice and round,
laying there, right on the ground.
I’m so excited, I can’t wait to go!

We’re going to the pumpkin patch,
looking for a pumpkin.
We’re going to the pumpkin patch
to make a jack-o’-lantern.

La Da Da Da Da Di Da.
La Da Da Di Da Da Da.
La Da Da Da Da Di Da.
La Da Da Di Da Da Da.

There’s so many things to do.
We could take a hayride too.
We’ll run around through a corn maze!

We’ll pick some apples off a tree.
One for you, and one for me.
This is going to be the best day!

We’re going to the pumpkin patch,
looking for a pumpkin.
We’re going to the pumpkin patch
to make a jack-o’-lantern.

La Da Da Da Da Di Da.
La Da Da Di Da Da Da.
La Da Da Da Da Di Da.
La Da Da Di Da Da Da.

Then we’ll scoop, scoop, scoop, scoop
out all the seeds inside,
and we’ll carve, carve, carve, carve
a mouth, a nose and eyes.
Then we’ll find the perfect place
to put our pumpkin down.
We’ll light it up with candles
for the town!

We’re going to the pumpkin patch,
looking for a pumpkin.
We’re going to the pumpkin patch
to make a jack-o’-lantern.

We’re going to the pumpkin patch,
looking for a pumpkin.
We’re going to the pumpkin patch
to make a jack-o’-lantern.

La Da Da Da Da Di Da.
La Da Da Di Da Da Da.
La Da Da Da Da Di Da.
La Da Da Di Da Da Da.

La Da Da Da Da Da Da Di Da.
La Da Da Di Da Da Da.
La Da Da Da Da Di Da.
La Da Da Di Da Da Da.

One night I woke to a very loud sound.
The wind was howling as the rain came down.
When I heard the thunder I knew for sure,
it was a super spooky Halloween storm.

It was a super spooky Halloween storm.
A super spooky Halloween storm.
The storm would give you quite a fright,
on that super spooky Halloween night!

And the wind goes whoosh whoosh.
Whoosh whoosh.
Whoosh whoosh.
It was a super spooky Halloween storm!

And the rain goes pitter patter pitter patter.
Pitter patter pitter patter.
Pitter patter pitter patter.
It was a super spooky Halloween storm.

It was a super spooky Halloween storm.
A super spooky Halloween storm.
The storm would give you quite a fright,
on that super spooky Halloween night!

And the thunder goes boom boom!
Boom boom!
Boom boom!
It was a super spooky Halloween storm!

Put them all together, and the Halloween storm gets louder.

Boom, whoosh, pitter patter pitter patter.
Boom, whoosh, pitter patter pitter patter.
Boom, whoosh, pitter patter pitter patter.
Boom, whoosh, pitter patter pitter patter.

Wait! Listen!
The storm is calming down
and it’s quiet now.
The moon is shining bright.
Oh, what a peaceful night.

It was a super spooky Halloween storm.
A super spooky Halloween storm.
The thunder and wind and rain gave a fright
on this super spooky Halloween night.

It was a super spooky Halloween storm.
A super spooky Halloween storm.
The thunder and wind and rain gave a fright
on this super spooky Halloween night.

Boo!

videos.title: ABC Hop | Hop Along Alphabet Songs For Kids! | Super Simple Songs
videos.description:
Get the Super Simple App! ► http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp 
Hop! Hop! Hop! Are you ready to hop like a bunny while learning your ABCs? Let's GO!!! 

PARENTS AND TEACHERS: Thank you so much for watching Super Simple Songs with your families and/or students. Here are some other places to find great Super Simple content:

► SUPER SIMPLE APP -- http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp Be the first to watch new Super Simple videos in the Super Simple App! Ad-free and designed for young learners.
► YOUTUBE KIDS -- http://bit.ly/You-Tube-Kids Designed to make it safer and simpler for young ones to watch online video, YouTube Kids includes a suite of parental controls so you can tailor the experience to suit your family’s needs.
► AMAZON VIDEO Are you an Amazon Prime member? Watch Super Simple videos ad-free on Amazon Prime Video. Just search for “Super Simple.”

FREE SUPER SIMPLE TEACHING RESOURCES: http://bit.ly/SSFree-Resources

SOCIAL MEDIA:
Super Simple Newsletter Sign Up: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSignUp
Facebook: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleFacebook
Instagram: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleInsta
Twitter: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleTwitter
Pinterest: http://bit.ly/SuperSimplePinterest 
*********
LYRICS: 
Let’s play ABC Hop! We’re going to sing the ABC song, but if we see a bunny instead of a letter, we’re going to hop like a bunny! Here we go!

A, B, C, D, E, F, G,
H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O, [HOP],
Q, R, S,
T, U, [HOP],
W, X,
Y, and Z.

Great hopping! Let’s try again!

A, B, C, [HOP], E, F, G,
H, I, J, [HOP], L, M, N, O, P,
Q, R, [HOP],
T, U, V,
W, [HOP],
Y and Z.

Yikes, it’s getting a little harder. Here we go again!

A, [HOP], C, D, E, F, G,
H, I, J, [HOP], L, M, N, O, [HOP],
Q, R, S,
T, [HOP], [HOP],
W, X,
Y, and [HOP].

There are so many bunnies in here! Let’s sing again!

A, [HOP], C, [HOP], E, F, [HOP],
H, [HOP], J, K, L, M, [HOP], O, P,
[HOP], R, S,
T, U, [HOP],
W, [HOP],
[HOP], and [HOP].

Great job everyone! What? You want to try one more time? Okay! Here we go!

A, [HOP], C, [HOP], E, [HOP], G,
H, [HOP], J, [HOP], L, M, [HOP], [HOP], [HOP],
Q, [HOP], S,
[HOP], U, V,
W, [HOP].

videos.description:
Get the Super Simple App!  ► http://bit.ly/TheSuperSimpleApp
It's okay to have more than one favorite! 🎶 I love my little garbage truck. It’s my favorite toy. I love my little garbage truck. It brings me so much joy. 🎶

Instagram: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleInsta
Twitter: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleTwitter

Lyrics: 
I love my little garbage truck.
It’s my favorite toy.
I love my little garbage truck.
It brings me so much joy.

On garbage day I wait outside
to watch the truck go by.
It picks up all the trash cans
and it dumps them all inside.

Then I pick up my little garbage truck
and play with it some more.

I love my little mail truck.
It’s my favorite toy.
I love my little mail truck.
It brings me so much joy.

When the mail carrier comes
I watch her as she passes by.
She puts the mail in the mailbox
and she waves and says, "Goodbye."

Then I pick up my little mail truck
and play with it some more.

I love my little fire truck.
It’s my favorite toy.
I love my little fire truck.
It brings me so much joy.

When the truck goes flying by
I watch it on its way.
I know it’s helping people
and it’s here to save the day.

Then I pick up my little fire truck
and play with it some more.

I love my little ice cream truck.
It’s my favorite toy.
I love my ice cream truck.
It brings me so much joy.

I like to hear the ice cream truck
come driving down the street.
And then the driver stops and people
buy themselves a treat.

Then I pick my little ice cream truck
and play with it some more.

Okay, I have a lot of favorite toys.

Baby elephant,
wave your trunk up high.

way up to the sky.
